attributes.action: Financial support for those who make under 50% of income through self employment
attributes.additional_details:
Many people make their money from a mix of employed/ self employed work. The decision not to help those who make under 50% of their money from self employment seems to suggest that those workers don't count on that money. Try telling someone in full employment that a potential 49% of their income is irrelevant. 
If the government is willing to pay up to £2,500 per month to those earning up to £50,000 a year from self employment, why won't they help the self employed asking for much less?
attributes.background: The government is currently offering no support grant to workers who's self employed earnings make up under 50% of their total annual income. The government should extend their offer of a support grant to cover ALL self employed workers, not just those who make over 50% of their money that way

rejection.details:

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
